ST.xhtml:p: BIT_OF_DWORD := (SHR(in,N) AND 16#00000001) > 0; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function extracts a single bit from the nth position from right (right is lowest bit the lowest Bit (Bit0 from in) is selected with N=0
checks an input for even value the output is true if the input is even
this function loads a bit into a Word at position pos
Output current execution time in miliseconds

ST.xhtml:p:
LEAP_DAY := IDATE MOD UDINT#126230400 = UDINT#68169600;
(* From OSCAT LIBRARY, www.oscat.de *)

YEAR_END := DWORD_TO_UDINT(SHR(UDINT_TO_DWORD(INT_TO_UDINT(y) * UDINT#1461 - UDINT#2876712), 2)) * UDINT#86400;
(* From OSCAT LIBRARY, www.oscat.de *)

MONTH_END := SET_DATE(YEAR_OF_DATE(idate),MONTH_OF_DATE(idate)+1,1) - UDINT#86400;
(* From OSCAT LIBRARY, www.oscat.de *)

DATE_TO_DT := IN;
(* From OSCAT LIBRARY, www.oscat.de *)

TIME_TO_TOD := DWORD_TO_UDINT(TIME_TO_DWORD(IN));
(* From OSCAT LIBRARY, www.oscat.de *)

TOD_TO_TIME := DWORD_TO_TIME(UDINT_TO_DWORD(IN));
(* From OSCAT LIBRARY, www.oscat.de *)

year_begin := DWORD_TO_UDINT(SHR(UDINT_TO_DWORD(INT_TO_UDINT(y) * UDINT#1461 - UDINT#2878169),2)) * UDINT#86400;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: returs the date of january 1st for the given year the function works for dates from 1970 - 2099
leap_year is true if the tested year is a leap year
calculates the work week for a given date according to iso8601
REFRACTION calculates the atmospheric refraction in degrees. the input angle goes from 0 at the hirizon to 90 at midday.

ST.xhtml:p:
hour_to_time := UDINT_TO_TIME(REAL_TO_UDINT(IN * 3600000.0));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts an amount of hours in real to time

ST.xhtml:p:
hour_to_tod := REAL_TO_UDINT(IN * 3600000.00);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts an amount of hours in real to time of day TOD
this FUNCTION calculates the time when the sun stand exactly south of a given location
date_add adds days, weeks, month or years to a date. negative inputs are allowed for subtraction.
easter calculates the day of easter sunday for a given year. most other catholic holidays are calculated in reference to easter

ST.xhtml:p:
DAY_OF_WEEK := UDINT_TO_INT((idate / UDINT#86400 + UDINT#3) MOD UDINT#7) + INT#01;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: calculates the weekday of a week according to ISO8601 monday = 1 ..... sunday = 7
returns the day OF month for any DATE

ST.xhtml:p:
LEAP_OF_DATE := SHL(UDINT_TO_DWORD((idate + UDINT#43200) / UDINT#31557600), 30) = DWORD#16#80000000;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: leap_of_date is true if current year is a leap year
calculates the day of the year
returns the current month of the year

ST.xhtml:p:
hour := UDINT_TO_INT(itod / UDINT#3600000);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: extracts the hour of a Time_of_day

ST.xhtml:p:
day_of_date := UDINT_TO_DINT(idate / UDINT#86400);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: creates a date output from year, month and day of month
creates a date output from year, month and day of month year must be in the form of 4 digits ie 2006 or 1977

ST.xhtml:p:
_DT_TO_DATE := (IN / UDINT#86400) * UDINT#86400;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: Zeitanteil aus Date-Time herausfiltern

ST.xhtml:p:
YEAR_OF_DATE := UDINT_TO_INT((IDATE+UDINT#43200) / UDINT#31557600 + UDINT#1970);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: returs the year of a date the function works for dates from 1970 - 2099

this functions returns TRUE IF dst TIME is active the FUNCTION calculates automatically for any year betweek 1970 AND 2099 wheather daylight savings is on OR off the summertime calculation is done according to european standards. dst will become TRUE AT 01:00 utc in the morning FOR the respective days AND it will become FALSE after daylight savings TIME is switched back end OF october at 01:00 utc

ltime is a real time clock that uses the system rtc as utc time and calculates and given time zone. the utc time is supplied on the input UTC. according to the input variable time_zone_offset when the input dst_enable is true, the dst on and off times are calculated by a formula for any given year and the time is advanced and reset by one hour at 02:00 and 03:00 for the last sunday of march and last sunday of october. the code is high performance and the rtc counts every second. if more then one time zone is needed by the systen the clock can be started many times by placing more then one function block
this function converts degrees into Radiant execution time

ST.xhtml:p: RAD := modR(0.0174532925199433 * _deg , 6.283185307179586476); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function converts Radiant to degrees
This is a rounding function which returns the biggest possible integer which is less or equal to X. floor2(3.14) = 3 floor2(-3.14) = -4
modulo funtion for real numbers modr(5.5,2.5) = 0.5

ST.xhtml:p:
day_to_time := DINT_TO_TIME(UDINT_TO_DINT(REAL_TO_UDINT(IN * REAL#86400000.00)));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts an amount of days in real to time
days_delta calculates the days between two dates
returs the total days of the current month
returs the total days of the year
this is a decoder for a DCF77 signal
converts date and time of day to Structured date time (SDT)
converts date_time to Structured date time (SDT)

ST.xhtml:p:
HOUR_OF_DT := UDINT_TO_INT((XDT MOD UDINT#86400) / UDINT#3600);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: HOUR_OF_DT returns the current hour (hour of the day) of a DT variable

ST.xhtml:p:
JD2000 := UDINT_TO_REAL(DTI - UDINT#946728000) / 86400.0;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: JULIAN calculates the astronomic julian date from 1.1.2000-12:00
LTIME_TO_UTC calculates UTC (World Time) from a local time LTIME

ST.xhtml:p:
_minute := UDINT_TO_INT((itod / UDINT#60000) - ((itod / UDINT#3600000) * UDINT#60));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: extracts the minutes out of TOD truncating the ceconds

ST.xhtml:p:
MINUTE_OF_DT := UDINT_TO_INT((XDT MOD UDINT#3600) / UDINT#60);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: MINUTE_OF_DT returns the current minute (minute of the hour) of a DT

ST.xhtml:p:
minute_to_time := UDINT_TO_TIME(REAL_TO_UDINT(IN * 60000.0));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts an amount of minutes in real to time

ST.xhtml:p:
MONTH_BEGIN := idate - INT_TO_UDINT(DAY_OF_MONTH(idate) - 1) * UDINT#86400;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: returns the date for the first day of the current month

ST.xhtml:p:
_multime := DWORD_TO_TIME(REAL_TO_DWORD(DWORD_TO_REAL(TIME_TO_DWORD(_t))*M));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: multiplies a time by a real number and returns a time
PERIOD checks if a given date is between two dates
RTC_MS is a real time clock module which can be set to SDT
RTC_2 is a real time clock

_SDT_TO_DATE := SET_DATE(DTI.YEAR, DTI.MONTH, DTI.DAY);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts Structured date time (SDT) to Date Time

ST.xhtml:p:
_SDT_TO_DT := SET_DT(DTI.YEAR, DTI.MONTH, DTI.DAY, DTI.HOUR, DTI.MINUTE, DTI.SECOND);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts Structured date time (SDT) to Date Time

ST.xhtml:p:
_SDT_TO_TOD := INT_TO_UDINT(DTI.HOUR) * UDINT#3600000 + INT_TO_UDINT(DTI.MINUTE) * UDINT#60000 + INT_TO_UDINT(DTI.SECOND) * UDINT#1000 + INT_TO_UDINT(DTI.MS);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts Structured date time (SDT) to Date Time

ST.xhtml:p:
_second := UDINT_TO_REAL(itod MOD UDINT#60000) / REAL#1000.00;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: returns the seconds and milliseconds as real of TOD

ST.xhtml:p:
SECOND_OF_DT := UDINT_TO_INT(XDT MOD UDINT#60);
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: SECOND_OF_DT returns the current second (second of minute) of a DT

ST.xhtml:p:
second_to_time := UDINT_TO_TIME(REAL_TO_UDINT(IN * 1000.0));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: converts an amount of seconds in real to time

ST.xhtml:p:
set_Tod := REAL_TO_UDINT(second * 1000.0) + INT_TO_UDINT(minute) * UDINT#60000 + INT_TO_UDINT(_hour) * UDINT#3600000;
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)
